abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second
            Telecommunications Project for Ghana were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, International Development
            Association (IDA's) performance was satisfactory, and
            the Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: (a) state-owned monopolies generally are
            unable to satisfy the demand for services and to mobilize
            the investment and skills needed to develop the
            telecommunications sector; and (b) in today's
            increasingly global and competitive economy, performance in
            the telecommunications sector can be improved significantly
            through the introduction of fundamental sector reforms which
            allow private participation and the introduction of a
            competitive market structure.
